result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Marese Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to submit to DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling, evaluation and treatment per agent.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Marese Walker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donald Marese Walker in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller and Rick S. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 1.  Attorney Middleton gives joint recommendation.  State agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Attorney Middleton believes there are 5 days credit.  State request stipulation.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
2 years Probation
Submit to DNA sample
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
$268.00 costs & $250.00 DNA sample & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Donald Marese Walker in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial br. 2.  Bond continues.
Defendant Donald Marese Walker in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.
Preliminary hearing on April 17, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Donald Marese Walker in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Middleton requests prelim.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Pre-trial conference on February 26, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Return date on March 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Donald Marese Walker in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton request PTC/RD. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on January 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Return date on February 5, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Donald Marese Walker in court, in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request signature bond.  Extradition for Missouri.  Time limits waived. $500.00 SIGANTURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking before leaving Sauk County Jail.  Waiver of extradition to State of Missouri.  Defendant agrees.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
